Class ALogFileWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.landenlabs.all_log.alog.ALogFileWriter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ALogOut.LogPrinter

    public class ALogFileWriter
extends java.lang.Object
implements ALogOut.LogPrinter
    Custom Log output saves to a private log file

    • Method Detail

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Clear current logging by closing and deleting current file, then re-open file.

      • close

        public void close()
        Close current log file. Subsequent logging will fail until re-opened.

      • delete

        public void delete()
        Close and Delete file. Log file is not re-opened, so subsequent logging will fail.

      • deleteFile

        public static void deleteFile(@Nullable
                              java.io.File file)

        public int maxTagLen()
        Specified by:
        maxTagLen in interface ALogOut.LogPrinter

      • open

        public void open(android.content.Context context)
        Open default file with default file size. 
         File stored in Download directory:
     /storage/emulated/0/Download/package.name.filelog.txt
 Example:
     /storage/emulated/0/Download/com.wsicarousel.android.weather.filelog.txt
        Specified by:
        open in interface ALogOut.LogPrinter

      • open

        public void open(java.lang.String logFileName,
                 long fileSizeLimit)
        Open new log file with maximum file size. When logging exceeds maximum size it will be archived and a new file opened. Only one archived file kept.

      • println

        public void println(int level,
                    java.lang.String tag,
                    java.lang.String msg)
        Print log level, tag and message.
        Specified by:

      • setDir

        public void setDir(java.lang.String logDir)
        Set file directory. Defaults to Cache directory.
        • getCacheDir
        • getFilesDir()

      • setFormat

        public void setFormat(java.lang.String fmt)
        Set row format for four fields:
        • Date Time string
        • Severity character
        • Tag string
        • Message string
        Examples:
        • "%s/%c %s - %s"
        • "%s,%c,%s,%s"
        • %1$s,%4$s
